page.title: 06THE FRANCISCAN CONVENT
page.content: The convent was built in 1888 and was bought in 1957 by the Franciscan Sisters from the Sadd family who were timbermerchants in Maldon.The Sisters came to the area because the Bishop wanted a school east of London which would provide a suitable education for catholics.The house was in five flats to begin with but these were converted to classrooms and living accomodation. In 1982 the school moved out of the convent buildings and the house was completely renovated and refurnished. It has 9 bedrooms,2 lounges,dining room,visitor's room,a large kitchen,a chapel and cellars for storage. There are seven sisters-1 superior,1 bursar,a headmistress,3 teachers and a sister who works in the parish.All the sisters share the work such as cooking cleaning,gardening and shopping.
